entries.femaleVariant: Let's get her inside!
I cannot hold it!
Easy now.
Gotta cut my way through the occipital bone. No other way.
It's neurogenic shock. She's dying.
Pressure's tanking!
I need... to rest…
That your blood?
Misty!
There is risk of--
I know what I'm doing.
How is she?
Slower on the mend than you, but lookin' better every day.
Misty!
C'mon, V, let's get you home.
You don't just die and then rise from the grave.
So I'm Frankenstein. Great.
You're Doctor Viktor and I'm your monster. Perfect.
People don't just die and then get up like nothing happened.
Used to be true. Now, it's only if they don't have a classified piece of corpo tech primed to resurrect them.
What about me, my psyche? I make it back from the other side, and what – I'm supposed to pretend change is normal?
Ask the Arasaka engineers who built the thing. All I know is your mind's gonna go and it won't be pretty.
From the biochip's perspective, your brain cells are a tumor that needs to be scooped out, while your body's an empty shell to hold the construct.
So this fucking terrorist wants to wipe me and take my place, take my body.
The biochip... it's basically a bomb, fuse lit already. You don't have much time left, much... life. A few weeks tops.
Silverhand's construct is overwriting your consciousness – gradually taking over your body until one day you'll just be... gone.
V. It's important you get all this.
You'll fix me up, right?
You're talkin' bullshit.
You'll fix me up, right? Vik?
If I could, I would, V,  believe me. But this is... way beyond what I know how to do.
Don't believe an ounce of the horseshit comin' from your mouth. Know why?
Because it doesn't make any goddamn sense.
Sayin' I experienced another psyche's memories? How's that possible?
What is, then?
First time ever I've seen you scared.
Doubt you can top the terrorist in my brain…
What is?
Never given me that look before, Vik. What is it?
Think you can top the terrorist in my brain?
You, uh, don't got a lot of time left, kid.
Say what now?
Why do I have to die?
I want to know the detes, all of 'em.
You're the best of the best, Vik. Why can't you help me?
Want the long story or the short?
I have to die, I am going to die – that what you're saying? Prove it.
Don't omit a thing, not one dete.
You jacked it in your chipslot. Nothing happened, right? Until you died.
Bullet in the head from Dexter DeShawn. But, how do you come back from something like that?
Low caliber – you lucked out. Not least thanks to another poor decision by Mr. DeShawn.
Hm. Dex shot you, right? The bullet damaged your chipslot AND your brain.
The biochip revived and… short-circ'd you. Started uploading data INTO your head.
OK. There was, is, a construct, a psyche on the chip. That of Johnny Silverhand.
So what am I supposed to do?
Can't we just remove the chip?
Vik, you've always come through for me.
Can't we just take the chip out? Or switch it off?
Either way's out of the question. You'd die, immediately.
I wish I knew, kid.
V? You in there?
Ugh... my head.
How ya feelin'?
Hang on, mean to say there's an actual terrorist in my head – right now?
That's right. Johnny Silverhand.
Had his crowning moment about fifty years ago.
AHQ Bombing – heard of it? His doing. People say he was buried under the rubble…
Dunno, Vik... ears're ringin'. And I'm seein' shit…
These... hallucinations – describe 'em to me?
Blinding lights. It's loud. I'm on stage and almost can't breathe. I'm so damn full of... hatred.
Then I let it all out into a mic. And I realize it didn't help, I don't feel any better.
And then, promise not to laugh, I plant a bomb in Arasaka Tower.
Nothin' there to laugh about…
They killed me.
Night City looked... different.
They killed me, Vik.
Never been so afraid.
Night City looked different… strange.
And I hated it. Hated everybody, every inch.
[Sit] I feel... like something ain't right.
It was too real, even for a lucid dream.
You weren't dreaming, V. Those were memories.
There's a personality construct on that shard. Dreams you had were from his past.
How's that even possible?
Mean to say there's a terrorist in my head?
If there's nothing you can do to help me, then... well, what the hell do I do? Tell me, please.
Vik?
It's that shard from those TV ads!
Fuck, I remember this thing, saw it on TV... What was that stupid slogan? Soul something?
That's it! It's just supposed to let you communicate with constructs.
Maybe. But this is a prototype, by the look of things. Somehow made it out of Arasaka labs.
You two're connected in a way I can't make head or tail of.
Two? Me and who, Vik, who's the other?
Johnny Silverhand. A terrorist – real talk o' the town back in my day.
Anyway, that's not what's important right now…
As far as it was concerned, your brain was an empty vessel that needed to be filled by the engram it was carrying.
Empty vessel? But I'm right here – all of this is me!
The shard doesn't read, it writes. Headache of yours? It's the biochip rewiring your neural pathways, building new neural structures, doing away with the old.
From where the shard's sitting, YOU, what's left – it's all a tumor that needs to be excised.
It's not willful on his part. It's automatic, inevitable. And neither of you can stop it.
The nannites off the chip started fixing the damage. Then they took your hand and coaxed you off the path towards the light.
Your body's only a body. You can modify it, replace it with chrome – hell, get a new one altogether.
"Secure Your Soul."
Your mind, though? Heh, that's a whole 'nother story.
You're askin' too much from an old-timer like Vik.
Whatever's happening to me, there's a logical explanation, gotta be.
Fuck…
Fuck…
V?
Talk to me.
